Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study included 379 patients

Participants.evidence: 379 patients with over 50% total body surface area burns admitted to three burn centers in China

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to explore the relationship between RBC transfusion volume and mortality in burn patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was in-hospital mortality.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The relationship between RBC transfusion volume and mortality was L-shaped, with a significant increase in risk at low transfusion volumes (p < 0.0001).
